headline: 'What about Q1 earnings?' US-China trade war weighs on chip stocks
summary: US-China trade war tensions drag US stocks lower after Nvidia (NVDA) reported restrictions on exports to China would cost the chipmaker $5.5 billion. CFRA Research chief investment strategist Sam Stovall joins Morning Brief with Madison Mills and Brad Smith to discuss what the uncertainty means for first quarter earnings and chipmakers' outlooks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.
